title: Italy vs Albania suspended as away fans throw smoke bombs on pitch in Palermo
text:
Sport Italy vs Albania suspended as away fans throw smoke bombs on pitch in Palermo The incident threatened to ruin Gianluigi Buffon's big night as the legendary shot-stopper made his 1000th career appearance Share Albania fans forced the game to be suspended (Photo: AFP/Getty Images)   Thank you for subscribing!   
Italy vs Albania was suspended during the second half as away fans threw smoke bombs on to the pitch in Palermo. 
The incident threatened to ruin Gianluigi Buffon's big night as the legendary shot-stopper made his 1000th career appearance. 
Daniele De Rossi had put Italy ahead in the World Cup qualifier with a penalty after 12 minutes. 
The players were forced to retire to the changing rooms as smoke began to fill the Stadiu Renzo Barbera with around half an hour remaining. Buffon played in his 1,000th career game in Palermo (Photo: AFP) 
Despite hitting his 1,000th game - Buffon insists he is refusing to think about retirement. 
"As far as I'm concerned, it will be a great achievement and the only assurance I can give is that there will not be another thousand," he joked. 
Asked if he might retire after the 2018 World Cup, he added: "I don't know, now I just have to think about the upcoming games." Like us on Facebook
